• 1 cup all-purpose flour • 2 tablespoons sugar • 1 teaspoon baking powder • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda • 1/4 teaspoon salt • 1 cup buttermilk • 1 large egg • 2 tablespoons melted butter • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Instructions:
• In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. • In another bowl, combine buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. • Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. • Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it. • Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. • Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown. • Serve with syrup and your favorite toppings.
Scrambled Eggs Ingredients:
• 4 large eggs • 1/4 cup milk • Salt and pepper to taste • 1 tablespoon butter Instructions:
• In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. • Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt the butter. • Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. • Cook, stirring gently, until the eggs are set but still soft. • Serve immediately.

 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup mushrooms, sliced  1 cup beef broth  1 cup sour cream  2 tablespoons flour  2 tablespoons butter  1 teaspoon paprika  Salt and pepper to taste  Egg noodles or rice for serving Instructions:
 In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.  Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.  Add sliced beef and cook until browned.  Stir in mushrooms and cook until tender.  Sprinkle flour over the mixture and stir to combine.  Gradually add beef broth, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens.  Stir in sour cream and paprika, season with salt and pepper.  Simmer for a few minutes until heated through.  Serve over egg noodles or rice.

Lasagna
Ingredients:
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, cook ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned.
Stir in marinara sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, grated Parmesan cheese, basil, and oregano.
Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in a baking dish.
Layer with 3 lasagna noodles, 1/3 of the ricotta mixture, 1/3 of the meat sauce, and 1/3
of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
Repeat layers twice more.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

 1 whole duck  1/4 cup soy sauce  1/4 cup honey  2 tablespoons hoisin sauce  2 tablespoons rice vinegar  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 teaspoon five-spice powder  1 teaspoon grated ginger  1/4 cup green onions, sliced  Mandarin pancakes for serving Instructions:
 Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  In a bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, minced garlic, five-spice powder, and grated ginger.  Brush the mixture over the duck.  Place duck on a roasting rack and roast for 1 hour and 30 minutes until skin is crispy.  Let rest before carving.  Serve duck with sliced green onions and mandarin pancakes.
Pork Schnitzel Ingredients:
 4 pork cutlets  1/2 cup flour  2 eggs, beaten  1 cup breadcrumbs  1/4 cup vegetable oil  1 lemon, sliced  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:
 Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper.  Dredge cutlets in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.  In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.  Cook cutlets until golden and crispy on both sides.  Serve with lemon slices.

Instructions:

Roast Beef
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, mix minced garlic, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, olive oil, salt, and
pepper.
Rub the mixture over the beef roast.
Place the roast in a roasting pan and cook for 1 hour and 30 minutes until desired

Salmon en Papillote
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Parchment paper
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut parchment paper into large squares.
Place a salmon fillet in the center of each square.
Top with lemon slices, sliced onion, and sliced zucchini.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with chopped dill, salt, and pepper.
Fold the parchment paper over the salmon and seal the edges to form a packet.
Place packets on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until salmon is cooked

Baked Ziti
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cook ziti according to package instructions, then drain.
In a skillet, cook ground beef or sausage with diced onion and minced garlic until
browned.
Stir in marinara sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper, and simmer for 10 minutes.
In a baking dish, layer half the ziti, half the sauce, dollops of ricotta, and half the
mozzarella. Repeat layers.
Top with grated Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Serve warm.
Butter Chicken
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped cilantro for garnish
Cooked rice or naan for serving
Instructions:

 1 pound ziti pasta  1 pound ground beef or Italian sausage  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 jar (24 ounces) marinara sauce  1 cup ricotta cheese  1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese  1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese  1 teaspoon dried oregano  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:
 Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  Cook ziti according to package instructions, then drain.  In a skillet, cook ground beef or sausage with diced onion and minced garlic until browned.  Stir in marinara sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper, and simmer for 10 minutes.  In a baking dish, layer half the ziti, half the sauce, dollops of ricotta, and half the mozzarella. Repeat layers.  Top with grated Parmesan cheese.  Bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden.  Serve warm.
Butter Chicken Ingredients:
 1 pound boneless chicken thighs, cubed  1 cup plain yogurt  1 tablespoon lemon juice  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 teaspoon grated ginger  1 teaspoon garam masala  1 teaspoon turmeric  1 teaspoon cumin  1 can (14.5 ounces) tomato puree  1/2 cup heavy cream  2 tablespoons butter  Salt and pepper to taste  Chopped cilantro for garnish  Cooked rice or naan for serving Instructions:

 1 pound boneless chicken thighs, cubed  1 cup plain yogurt  1 tablespoon lemon juice  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 teaspoon grated ginger  1 teaspoon garam masala  1 teaspoon turmeric  1 teaspoon cumin  1 can (14.5 ounces) tomato puree  1/2 cup heavy cream  2 tablespoons butter  Salt and pepper to taste  Chopped cilantro for garnish  Cooked rice or naan for serving Instructions:
In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, garam masala, turmeric, and cumin.
Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 1 hour.
In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add marinated chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato puree and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add heavy cream, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice or naan.
Chili Con Carne
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Shredded cheese and sour cream for garnish
Instructions:
In a large pot, cook ground beef with diced onion and garlic over medium heat until
browned.
Stir in kidney beans, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, chili powder, cumin, and
paprika.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with shredded cheese and sour cream.
Gnocchi with Sage Butter
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:

 1 pound ground beef  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 can (15 ounces) kidney beans, drained  1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes  1/4 cup tomato paste  1 cup beef broth  1 tablespoon chili powder  1 teaspoon cumin  1 teaspoon paprika  Salt and pepper to taste  Shredded cheese and sour cream for garnish Instructions:
 In a large pot, cook ground beef with diced onion and garlic over medium heat until browned.  Stir in kidney beans, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, beef broth, chili powder, cumin, and paprika.  Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Season with salt and pepper.  Serve hot, garnished with shredded cheese and sour cream.
Gnocchi with Sage Butter Ingredients:
 1 pound potato gnocchi  1/4 cup butter  2 cloves garlic, minced  8 fresh sage leaves  1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:

 1 pound potato gnocchi  1/4 cup butter  2 cloves garlic, minced  8 fresh sage leaves  1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:
Cook gnocchi according to package instructions, then drain.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sage leaves, sauté until fragrant and sage is crispy.
Add cooked gnocchi to the skillet and toss to coat in the butter sauce.
Season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Serve warm.
Honey Garlic Pork Ribs
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Sliced green onions for garnish
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Season ribs with salt, pepper, and paprika, then place in a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger. Pour over the ribs.
Cover with foil and bake for 2.5 hours, basting occasionally with the sauce.
Remove foil, increase oven to 400°F (200°C), and bake for 15-20 minutes until
caramelized.
Garnish with green onions and serve.
Moroccan Chicken Tagine
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste

 2 pounds pork ribs  1/4 cup honey  1/4 cup soy sauce  2 tablespoons rice vinegar  3 cloves garlic, minced  1 teaspoon grated ginger  1 teaspoon paprika  Salt and pepper to taste  Sliced green onions for garnish Instructions:
 Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).  Season ribs with salt, pepper, and paprika, then place in a baking dish.  In a bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger. Pour over the ribs.  Cover with foil and bake for 2.5 hours, basting occasionally with the sauce.  Remove foil, increase oven to 400°F (200°C), and bake for 15-20 minutes until caramelized.  Garnish with green onions and serve.
Moroccan Chicken Tagine Ingredients:
 4 chicken thighs  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup chicken broth  1/2 cup dried apricots, chopped  1/2 cup green olives  1 tablespoon olive oil  1 teaspoon cumin  1 teaspoon cinnamon  1 teaspoon turmeric  Salt and pepper to taste

 4 chicken thighs  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup chicken broth  1/2 cup dried apricots, chopped  1/2 cup green olives  1 tablespoon olive oil  1 teaspoon cumin  1 teaspoon cinnamon  1 teaspoon turmeric  Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped parsley for garnish
Cooked couscous for serving
Instructions:
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Brown chicken thighs on all sides, then set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Stir in cumin, cinnamon, and turmeric, then add chicken broth, apricots, and olives.
Return chicken to the pot, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes until tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley and serve over couscous.
Mushroom Risotto
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped parsley for garnish
Instructions:
Heat broth in a pot and keep warm.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat.
Sauté onion, garlic, and mushrooms until tender.
Add rice and stir for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in white wine and cook until absorbed.
Add warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring until absorbed before adding more, until
rice is creamy and tender (about 20 minutes).
Stir in remaining butter and Parmesan cheese, season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley and serve.
Pulled Pork Sandwiches
Ingredients:

 1 cup Arborio rice  4 cups chicken or vegetable broth  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup mushrooms, sliced  1/2 cup white wine  1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese  2 tablespoons butter  2 tablespoons olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste  Chopped parsley for garnish Instructions:
 Heat broth in a pot and keep warm.  In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat.  Sauté onion, garlic, and mushrooms until tender.  Add rice and stir for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.  Pour in white wine and cook until absorbed.  Add warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring until absorbed before adding more, until rice is creamy and tender (about 20 minutes).  Stir in remaining butter and Parmesan cheese, season with salt and pepper.  Garnish with parsley and serve.
Pulled Pork Sandwiches Ingredients:
 2 pounds pork shoulder  1 small onion, sliced  2 cloves garlic, minced

 2 pounds pork shoulder  1 small onion, sliced  2 cloves garlic, minced
Salt and pepper to taste
Buns for serving
Coleslaw for topping (optional)
Instructions:
Season pork shoulder with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika.
Place onion and garlic in a slow cooker, then add pork.
Mix barbecue sauce, chicken broth, and brown sugar, and pour over pork.
Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours until pork shreds easily.
Shred pork with forks and mix with sauce.
Serve on buns with coleslaw if desired.
Stuffed Chicken Breasts
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut a pocket into each chicken breast.
In a bowl, mix spinach, feta, sun-dried tomatoes, and garlic.
Stuff the mixture into the chicken pockets and secure with toothpicks if needed.
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear chicken on both sides.
Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked through.
Serve warm.
Vegetable Lasagna
Ingredients:

 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts  1/2 cup spinach, chopped  1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled  1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped  2 cloves garlic, minced  2 tablespoons olive oil  Salt and pepper to taste Instructions:
 Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  Cut a pocket into each chicken breast.  In a bowl, mix spinach, feta, sun-dried tomatoes, and garlic.  Stuff the mixture into the chicken pockets and secure with toothpicks if needed.  Season chicken with salt and pepper.  Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear chicken on both sides.  Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked through.  Serve warm.
Vegetable Lasagna Ingredients:
 9 lasagna noodles, cooked  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 zucchini, sliced

 9 lasagna noodles, cooked  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 zucchini, sliced
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onion, garlic, zucchini, and bell pepper
until tender. Add spinach and cook until wilted.
In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, salt, and pepper.
In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce. Layer 3 noodles, half the ricotta
mixture, half the vegetables, and 1/3 of the mozzarella. Repeat layers.
Top with remaining noodles, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20 minutes
until bubbly.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Albondigas
Ingredients:
o 1/2 pound ground beef
o 1/2 pound ground pork
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
o 1 egg
o 1 teaspoon paprika
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 cup tomato sauce
Instructions:
o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten
egg, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
o Form mixture into meatballs.
o Heat olive oil in a pan and brown meatballs on all sides.
o Add tomato sauce and simmer for 20 minutes.
o Serve warm.
Antipasto
Ingredients:
o Assorted cured meats (salami, prosciutto)
o Cheeses (mozzarella, provolone)
o Olives
o Marinated vegetables (artichokes, peppers)
o Breadsticks
Instructions:
o Arrange meats, cheeses, olives, and vegetables on a platter.
o Serve with breadsticks.
Arancini
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cooked risotto
o 1/2 cup mozzarella
o 1/2 cup flour
o 2 eggs
o 1 cup breadcrumbs
o 1 cup vegetable oil

Instructions:
o Form risotto into balls and stuff with a cube of mozzarella.
o Dredge balls in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Baba Ganoush
Ingredients:
o 2 eggplants
o 1/4 cup tahini
o 1/4 cup lemon juice
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Roast eggplants until soft, then peel and mash.
o Blend mashed eggplant, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food
processor.
o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth.
o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil.
Baked Beans
Ingredients:
o 4 cups cooked navy beans
o 1 small onion
o 1/2 cup molasses
o 1/4 cup brown sugar
o 1/4 cup ketchup
o 1 tablespoon mustard
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
o Sauté diced onion until translucent.
o Mix beans, onion, molasses, brown sugar, ketchup, mustard, salt, and pepper in a
baking dish.
o Bake for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
o Serve warm.
Bammy
Ingredients:
o 2 cups grated cassava
o 1/4 cup coconut milk
o 1 teaspoon salt

o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix grated cassava with coconut milk and salt.
o Form mixture into flat cakes.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Banchan
Ingredients:
o Assorted small side dishes like pickled radish, spinach, bean sprouts, kimchi
Instructions:
o Prepare each side dish separately.
o Arrange on small plates.
o Serve as accompaniments to the main meal.
Banh Beo
Ingredients:
o 1 cup rice flour
o 1/2 cup water
o 1/2 cup coconut milk
o 1/4 cup shrimp
o 1/4 cup green onions
o 1/4 cup fried shallots
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon sugar
Instructions:
o Mix rice flour, water, coconut milk, salt, and sugar to form a batter.
o Pour batter into small dishes and steam until set.
o Sauté chopped shrimp and green onions until cooked.
o Top steamed cakes with shrimp, green onions, and fried shallots.
o Serve with dipping sauce.
Banh Xeo
Ingredients:
o 1 cup rice flour
o 1/2 cup coconut milk
o 1/2 cup water
o 1/2 pound shrimp
o 1/2 pound pork
o 1 small onion
o 1/2 cup bean sprouts
o 1/4 cup green onions
o 1/4 cup cilantro
o 1 teaspoon turmeric

o 1 teaspoon salt
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix rice flour, coconut milk, water, turmeric, and salt to form a batter.
o Sauté sliced pork, shrimp, and diced onion until cooked.
o Heat oil in a pan and pour in a ladle of batter, swirling to coat the pan.
o Add cooked pork, shrimp, bean sprouts, green onions, and cilantro.
o Fold pancake in half and cook until crispy.
o Serve with lettuce and dipping sauce.
Basturma
Ingredients:
o 1 pound beef tenderloin
o 1/4 cup paprika
o 2 tablespoons cumin
o 2 tablespoons fenugreek
o 1 tablespoon garlic powder
o 1 tablespoon salt
Instructions:
o Rub beef with salt and let cure in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
o Rinse and pat dry.
o Mix paprika, cumin, fenugreek, and garlic powder, then coat beef with the
mixture.
o Wrap in cheesecloth and hang in a cool, dry place for 1-2 weeks.
o Slice thinly and serve.
Batbout
Ingredients:
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
o 1 teaspoon sugar
o 1 cup warm water
o 3 cups flour
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/4 cup olive oil
Instructions:
o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy.
o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil.
o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled.
o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles.
o Cook on a hot griddle until puffed and golden.
o Serve warm.
Bhindi Masala
Ingredients:

o 1 pound okra
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon coriander
o 1 teaspoon turmeric
o 1 teaspoon garam masala
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 2 tablespoons oil
Instructions:
o Wash and dry okra, then cut into pieces.
o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent.
o Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute.
o Add okra and stir to coat with spices.
o Cook until okra is tender, stirring occasionally.
o Add salt to taste and serve.
Bobotie
Ingredients:
o 1 pound ground beef
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup raisins
o 1/4 cup almonds
o 1 tablespoon curry powder
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
o 2 eggs
o 1/2 cup milk
o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
o Add ground beef, raisins, almonds, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook until
beef is browned.
o Transfer mixture to a baking dish.
o Beat eggs with milk and pour over the beef mixture.
o Sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
o Bake for 30 minutes until set and golden.
o Serve warm.
Bok Choy with Garlic
Ingredients:
o 1 pound bok choy

o 2 cloves garlic
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil
Instructions:
o Sauté minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant.
o Add bok choy and stir-fry until tender.
o Add soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
o Serve warm.
Bolinho de Bacalhau
Ingredients:
o 1 pound salted cod
o 4 potatoes
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 2 eggs
o 1 cup breadcrumbs
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Soak salted cod in water overnight, then rinse and flake.
o Boil potatoes until tender, then mash.
o Mix cod with mashed potatoes, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, and
beaten eggs.
o Form mixture into balls and coat with breadcrumbs.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Bouillabaisse
Ingredients:
o 1 pound fish fillets
o 1/2 pound shrimp
o 1/2 pound mussels
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 4 tomatoes
o 4 cups fish stock
o 1/2 cup white wine
o 1 teaspoon saffron
o 1 teaspoon thyme
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.

o Add diced tomatoes, fish stock, wine, saffron, thyme, salt, and pepper, simmer
for 20 minutes.
o Add fish fillets, shrimp, and mussels, cook until seafood is done.
o Serve hot with crusty bread.
Bratkartoffeln (Fried Potatoes)
Ingredients:
o 4 potatoes
o 1 small onion
o 1/4 cup bacon
o 2 tablespoons butter
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Boil potatoes until tender, then slice.
o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside.
o Sauté sliced potatoes and diced onion in butter until golden.
o Stir in bacon, salt, and pepper.
o Serve warm.
Briam
Ingredients:
o 2 potatoes
o 2 zucchinis
o 2 eggplants
o 2 tomatoes
o 1 small onion
o 4 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon oregano
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
o Slice potatoes, zucchinis, eggplants, and tomatoes.
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.
o Layer vegetables in a baking dish, seasoning with oregano, salt, and pepper.
o Pour sautéed onion and garlic over the top.
o Bake for 45 minutes until vegetables are tender.
o Serve warm.
Briouats
Ingredients:
o 1/2 pound ground beef

o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon cinnamon
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
o 1 package phyllo dough
o 1/4 cup butter
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked.
o Stir in chopped parsley, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
o Cut phyllo dough into strips and brush with melted butter.
o Place a spoonful of filling on each strip and fold into triangles.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Bruschetta
Ingredients:
o 1 baguette
o 4 tomatoes
o 1/4 cup basil
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Slice baguette and toast until golden.
o Dice tomatoes and chop basil.
o Mix tomatoes, basil, minced garlic, olive oil, and salt.
o Spoon mixture onto toasted bread and serve.
Bulgur Pilaf
Ingredients:
o 1 cup bulgur
o 2 cups chicken broth
o 1 small onion
o 1 carrot
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 2 tablespoons olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion and grated carrot in olive oil until softened.
o Add bulgur and cook for 2 minutes.

o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until bulgur is tender.
o Stir in chopped parsley and salt.
o Serve warm.
Ca Tim Nuong (Grilled Eggplant)
Ingredients:
o 2 eggplants
o 2 cloves garlic
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce
o 1 tablespoon lime juice
o 1 tablespoon sugar
o 1/4 cup cilantro
Instructions:
o Grill eggplants until charred and tender.
o Peel and slice eggplants.
o Mix minced garlic, fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar in a bowl.
o Toss eggplants with the dressing.
o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.
Callaloo
Ingredients:
o 1 pound callaloo leaves
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup coconut milk
o 1 teaspoon thyme
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
o Add callaloo leaves and cook until wilted.
o Stir in coconut milk, thyme, salt, and pepper.
o Simmer for 10 minutes.
o Serve warm.
Canh Chua
Ingredients:
o 4 cups fish stock
o 1/2 pound fish fillets
o 1 cup pineapple
o 1 cup tomatoes
o 1 cup bean sprouts
o 2 stalks lemongrass

o 2-3 Thai chilies
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce
o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste
o 1 tablespoon sugar
o 1/4 cup cilantro
Instructions:
o Bring fish stock to a boil.
o Add lemongrass, chilies, and tamarind paste, simmer for 10 minutes.
o Add pineapple, tomatoes, and fish fillets, cook until fish is done.
o Stir in fish sauce, sugar, and bean sprouts.
o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.
Caprese Salad
Ingredients:
o 4 tomatoes
o 1 pound fresh mozzarella
o 1/4 cup basil
o 2 tablespoons olive oil
o 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Slice tomatoes and mozzarella.
o Arrange on a plate, alternating slices.
o Sprinkle with chopped basil, olive oil, balsamic glaze, and salt.
o Serve immediately.
Carrot Salad
Ingredients:
o 4 carrots
o 1/4 cup raisins
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1/4 cup lemon juice
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Grate carrots and mix with raisins and chopped parsley.
o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt, then pour over salad.
o Toss well and serve chilled.
Ceviche
Ingredients:
o 1 pound fresh fish or shrimp
o 1 cup lime juice

o 1 small onion
o 2 tomatoes
o 1 jalapeño
o 1/4 cup cilantro
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Dice fish or shrimp and place in a bowl.
o Pour lime juice over the seafood and let marinate for 30 minutes.
o Dice onion, tomatoes, and jalapeño.
o Chop cilantro.
o Mix all ingredients together and add salt.
o Serve chilled.
Cha Gio
Ingredients:
o 1 package spring roll wrappers
o 1/2 pound ground pork
o 1/2 cup shrimp
o 1/2 cup mushrooms
o 1/4 cup carrots
o 1/4 cup green onions
o 2 cloves garlic
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce
o 1 tablespoon sugar
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix ground pork, chopped shrimp, diced mushrooms, julienned carrots, chopped
green onions, minced garlic, fish sauce, and sugar in a bowl.
o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.
Chakchouka
Ingredients:
o 4 tomatoes
o 2 bell peppers
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon paprika
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 4 eggs
o 1/4 cup cilantro

Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell peppers in olive oil until
softened.
o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes.
o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well.
o Cover and cook until eggs are set.
o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm.
Chana Masala
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cooked chickpeas
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon coriander
o 1 teaspoon garam masala
o 1 teaspoon turmeric
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1 can diced tomatoes
o 2 tablespoons oil
Instructions:
o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent.
o Add cumin, coriander, garam masala, and turmeric, cook for 1 minute.
o Add chickpeas and diced tomatoes, stir to combine.
o Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
o Add salt to taste and serve.
Chapati
Ingredients:
o 2 cups flour
o 1/4 cup oil
o 1/2 cup water
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Mix flour, oil, water, and salt to form a dough, then let rest.
o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles.
o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides.
o Serve warm.
Char Siu
Ingredients:
o 1 pound pork shoulder
o 1/4 cup hoisin sauce
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce

o 2 tablespoons honey
o 1 tablespoon rice wine
o 1 teaspoon five-spice powder
o 1 teaspoon garlic powder
Instructions:
o Mix hoisin sauce, soy sauce, honey, rice wine, five-spice powder, and garlic
powder in a bowl.
o Marinate pork in the mixture for at least 2 hours.
o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
o Place pork on a baking sheet and roast for 45 minutes, basting occasionally.
o Let rest before slicing and serving.
Chawanmushi
Ingredients:
o 2 eggs
o 1 cup dashi broth
o 1 tablespoon soy sauce
o 1 tablespoon mirin
o 1/4 cup chicken
o 1/4 cup shrimp
o 1/4 cup mushrooms
Instructions:
o Beat eggs with dashi broth, soy sauce, and mirin.
o Place chicken, shrimp, and mushrooms in small bowls.
o Pour egg mixture over the top.
o Steam for 15 minutes until set.
o Serve warm.
Chiles Rellenos
Ingredients:
o 4 poblano peppers
o 1 cup shredded cheese
o 1/2 cup flour
o 4 eggs
o 1 cup vegetable oil
o 1 cup tomato sauce
Instructions:
o Roast peppers until charred, then peel and remove seeds.
o Stuff peppers with cheese.
o Separate eggs and beat whites until stiff, then fold in yolks.
o Dredge peppers in flour, then dip in egg mixture.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Serve with warmed tomato sauce.

Cornbread
Ingredients:
o 1 cup cornmeal
o 1 cup flour
o 1/4 cup sugar
o 1 tablespoon baking powder
o 1/2 teaspoon salt
o 1 cup milk
o 1/4 cup vegetable oil
o 1 egg
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
o Mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
o Add milk, oil, and beaten egg, stir until combined.
o Pour batter into a greased baking pan.
o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden.
o Serve warm.
Coxinha
Ingredients:
o 2 cups shredded chicken
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1/4 cup cream cheese
o 1 cup flour
o 1 cup breadcrumbs
o 2 eggs
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
o Mix shredded chicken with onion, garlic, chopped parsley, and cream cheese.
o Form mixture into drumstick shapes.
o Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Croque Monsieur
Ingredients:
o 8 slices bread
o 4 slices ham
o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese
o 1/4 cup béchamel sauce

 Ingredients :
o 1 cup cornmeal o 1 cup flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1 cup milk o 1/4 cup vegetable oil o 1 egg  Instructions :
o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add milk, oil, and beaten egg, stir until combined. o Pour batter into a greased baking pan. o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Coxinha
 Ingredients :
o 2 cups shredded chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1/4 cup cream cheese o 1 cup flour o 1 cup breadcrumbs o 2 eggs o Oil for frying  Instructions :
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Mix shredded chicken with onion, garlic, chopped parsley, and cream cheese. o Form mixture into drumstick shapes. o Dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Croque Monsieur
 Ingredients :
o 8 slices bread o 4 slices ham o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese o 1/4 cup béchamel sauce

o 2 tablespoons butter
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
o Spread béchamel sauce on 4 slices of bread.
o Top with ham and grated cheese, then cover with remaining bread slices.
o Melt butter in a pan and toast sandwiches until golden.
o Transfer to a baking sheet, top with more béchamel sauce and cheese.
o Bake for 10 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
o Serve warm.
Croquetas
Ingredients:
o 1/2 cup butter
o 1/2 cup flour
o 2 cups milk
o 1/2 cup ham
o 1/4 cup grated cheese
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
o 1 cup breadcrumbs
o 2 eggs
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux.
o Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
o Stir in diced ham, grated cheese, salt, and nutmeg.
o Let mixture cool, then form into croquettes.
o Dredge croquettes in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Dal Tadka
Ingredients:
o 1 cup lentils
o 4 cups water
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon turmeric
o 1 teaspoon coriander
o 1 teaspoon garam masala
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 2 tablespoons oil
Instructions:

o Rinse lentils and cook in water until tender.
o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until translucent.
o Add cumin, turmeric, coriander, and garam masala, cook for 1 minute.
o Add cooked lentils and stir to combine.
o Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
o Add salt to taste and serve.
Deviled Eggs
Ingredients:
o 6 eggs
o 1/4 cup mayonnaise
o 1 tablespoon mustard
o 1 tablespoon vinegar
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon paprika
Instructions:
o Hard-boil eggs, then peel and halve.
o Remove yolks and mash with mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, and salt.
o Spoon or pipe yolk mixture into egg whites.
o Sprinkle with paprika and serve.
Dolmas
Ingredients:
o 1 jar grape leaves
o 1 cup rice
o 1 small onion
o 1/4 cup pine nuts
o 1/4 cup currants
o 1/4 cup lemon juice
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Rinse grape leaves and pat dry.
o Sauté diced onion in olive oil until translucent.
o Add rice, pine nuts, and currants, cook for 5 minutes.
o Add 1 cup water, lemon juice, and salt, simmer until rice is tender.
o Place a spoonful of rice mixture on each grape leaf and roll tightly.
o Arrange dolmas in a pot, cover with water, and simmer for 30 minutes.
o Serve warm or chilled.
Dumplings
Ingredients:
o 1 package dumpling wrappers
o 1/2 pound ground pork

o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1 tablespoon soy sauce
o 1 teaspoon sesame oil
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame
oil in a bowl.
o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal.
o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes.
o Serve with dipping sauce.
Edamame
Ingredients:
o 1 pound edamame (soybeans in pods)
o 1 tablespoon sea salt
Instructions:
o Steam or boil edamame until tender (about 5 minutes).
o Drain and sprinkle with sea salt.
o Serve warm.
Egusi Soup
Ingredients:
o 1 cup ground egusi seeds
o 1/2 pound beef
o 1/2 pound fish
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 4 tomatoes
o 1/4 cup palm oil
o 1 teaspoon crayfish powder
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
o 4 cups water
o 1/4 cup spinach
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in palm oil until softened.
o Add diced tomatoes, ground egusi seeds, and crayfish powder, cook for 5
minutes.
o Add beef, fish, salt, pepper, and water, simmer until meat is tender.
o Stir in chopped spinach and cook for 5 minutes.
o Serve warm.

Egg Rolls
Ingredients:
o 1 package egg roll wrappers
o 1 cup shredded cabbage
o 1/2 cup grated carrots
o 1/2 cup bean sprouts
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a
bowl.
o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.
Elote
Ingredients:
o 4 ears of corn
o 1/4 cup mayonnaise
o 1/4 cup sour cream
o 1/2 cup cotija cheese
o 1 teaspoon chili powder
o 1 lime
Instructions:
o Grill the corn until charred.
o Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl.
o Brush the mixture onto the corn.
o Sprinkle with cotija cheese and chili powder.
o Squeeze lime juice over the top and serve.
Empanadas
Ingredients:
o 2 cups flour
o 1/2 cup butter
o 1/4 cup water
o 1 egg
o 1/2 pound ground beef
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olives
o 1/4 cup raisins
o 1 teaspoon cumin

 Ingredients :
o 1 package egg roll wrappers o 1 cup shredded cabbage o 1/2 cup grated carrots o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions :
o Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a
bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce. Elote
 Ingredients :
o 4 ears of corn o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o 1/4 cup sour cream o 1/2 cup cotija cheese o 1 teaspoon chili powder o 1 lime  Instructions :
o Grill the corn until charred. o Mix mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl. o Brush the mixture onto the corn. o Sprinkle with cotija cheese and chili powder. o Squeeze lime juice over the top and serve. Empanadas
 Ingredients :
o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup butter o 1/4 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup raisins o 1 teaspoon cumin

o 1 teaspoon paprika
o 1 teaspoon salt
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix flour, butter, water, and beaten egg to form a dough, then let rest.
o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped olives, and raisins with
cumin, paprika, and salt until cooked.
o Roll out dough and cut into circles.
o Place a spoonful of filling on each circle and fold to seal.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Escalivada
Ingredients:
o 2 eggplants
o 2 bell peppers
o 2 tomatoes
o 1 small onion
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
o Roast eggplants, bell peppers, tomatoes, and onion until tender.
o Peel and slice vegetables.
o Arrange on a plate and drizzle with olive oil.
o Sprinkle with salt and serve warm or at room temperature.
Falafel
Ingredients:
o 1 can chickpeas
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon coriander
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/4 cup flour
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Drain and rinse chickpeas.
o Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, cumin, coriander,
and salt in a food processor.
o Add flour and mix until combined.
o Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden.

o Drain on paper towels and serve.
Farofa
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cassava flour
o 1/4 cup butter
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup bacon
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic in butter until crispy.
o Add cassava flour and cook, stirring constantly, until golden.
o Stir in chopped parsley and salt.
o Serve warm.
Fattoush
Ingredients:
o 2 pita breads
o 4 tomatoes
o 1 cucumber
o 1 small red onion
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1/4 cup mint
o 1/4 cup lemon juice
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon sumac
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Toast pita breads until crispy, then break into pieces.
o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion.
o Mix vegetables with chopped parsley and mint.
o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, sumac, and salt, then pour over salad.
o Toss well and serve.
Fava
Ingredients:
o 1 cup yellow split peas
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1/4 cup lemon juice
o 1 teaspoon salt

Instructions:
o Rinse split peas and cook in water until tender.
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.
o Blend cooked peas with onion, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth.
o Serve warm or chilled.
Feijão Tropeiro
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cooked beans
o 1/4 cup bacon
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup cassava flour
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic until crispy.
o Add cooked beans and cassava flour, stir to combine.
o Stir in chopped parsley and salt.
o Serve warm.
Festival
Ingredients:
o 2 cups flour
o 1/4 cup cornmeal
o 1/4 cup sugar
o 1 tablespoon baking powder
o 1/2 teaspoon salt
o 1/4 cup milk
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
o Add milk and stir until dough forms.
o Roll out dough and cut into strips.
o Fry in hot oil until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
Focaccia
Ingredients:
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
o 1 teaspoon sugar
o 1 cup warm water
o 2 1/2 cups flour
o 1 teaspoon salt

o 1/4 cup olive oil
o Rosemary
o Sea salt
Instructions:
o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy.
o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil.
o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled.
o Press dough into a baking pan, dimple with fingers, and sprinkle with rosemary
and sea salt.
o Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden.
Freekeh Salad
Ingredients:
o 1 cup freekeh
o 2 cups water
o 1 small onion
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1/4 cup mint
o 1/4 cup lemon juice
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Rinse freekeh and cook in water until tender, then drain.
o Sauté diced onion in olive oil until softened.
o Mix freekeh with sautéed onion, chopped parsley, and mint.
o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, and salt, then pour over salad.
o Toss well and serve.
Fried Plantains
Ingredients:
o 2 ripe plantains
o 1 cup vegetable oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Peel and slice plantains.
o Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until golden.
o Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
o Serve warm.
Fried Rice
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cooked rice
o 1 small onion
o 1/2 cup peas

o 1/2 cup diced carrots
o 2 eggs
o 2 tablespoons soy sauce
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil
o 1/4 cup chopped green onions
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion, peas, and carrots in sesame oil until softened.
o Push vegetables to the side and scramble eggs in the same pan.
o Add cooked rice and soy sauce, stir to combine.
o Cook until heated through.
o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.
Fufu
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cassava flour
o 4 cups water
Instructions:
o Bring water to a boil.
o Gradually add cassava flour, stirring constantly until thickened.
o Continue to cook, stirring, until smooth and elastic.
o Serve warm.
Gamja Jorim
Ingredients:
o 4 potatoes
o 1/4 cup soy sauce
o 2 tablespoons sugar
o 1 tablespoon sesame oil
o 1/4 cup water
o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
Instructions:
o Peel and dice potatoes.
o Sauté potatoes in sesame oil until lightly browned.
o Add soy sauce, sugar, and water, simmer until potatoes are tender.
o Garnish with sesame seeds and serve warm.
Garlic Bread
Ingredients:
o 1 baguette
o 1/2 cup butter
o 4 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup parsley
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:

o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
o Slice baguette in half lengthwise.
o Mix softened butter with minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt.
o Spread mixture on bread.
o Bake for 10-15 minutes until golden.
o Serve warm.
Gazpacho
Ingredients:
o 4 tomatoes
o 1 cucumber
o 1 small red onion
o 1 bell pepper
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Dice tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper.
o Blend vegetables with minced garlic, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper until
smooth.
o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
Gigantes Plaki
Ingredients:
o 2 cups giant beans
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 4 tomatoes
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon oregano
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender.
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.
o Add diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper, simmer for 10 minutes.
o Mix beans with tomato sauce and transfer to a baking dish.
o Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes.
o Serve warm.
Goi Cuon (Spring Rolls)
Ingredients:

o 1 package rice paper wrappers
o 1/2 pound shrimp
o 1/2 cup rice vermicelli
o 1/2 cup lettuce
o 1/4 cup mint
o 1/4 cup cilantro
o 1/4 cup basil
o 1/4 cup carrots
o 1/4 cup cucumber
Instructions:
o Cook shrimp and slice in half.
o Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions, then drain.
o Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable.
o Place a small amount of shrimp, vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, basil, julienned
carrots, and cucumber on each wrapper.
o Roll tightly and serve with dipping sauce.
Gomae (Spinach with Sesame Dressing)
Ingredients:
o 1 bunch spinach
o 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
o 1 tablespoon soy sauce
o 1 tablespoon sugar
o 1 tablespoon mirin
Instructions:
o Blanch spinach in boiling water, then rinse in cold water and squeeze out excess
moisture.
o Toast sesame seeds and grind them.
o Mix sesame seeds with soy sauce, sugar, and mirin.
o Toss spinach with dressing and serve.
Gratin Dauphinois
Ingredients:
o 4 potatoes
o 1 cup heavy cream
o 1/2 cup milk
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/2 cup grated Gruyère cheese
o 1 teaspoon salt

o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Toast bread cubes until golden.
o Dice tomatoes and cucumber, slice red onion.
o Mix bread, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and chopped basil.
o Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and salt, then pour over salad.
o Toss well and serve.
Papadum
Ingredients:
o 1 cup urad dal flour
o 1/4 cup water
o 1/2 teaspoon salt
o Oil for frying
Instructions:
o Mix urad dal flour, water, and salt to form a dough.
o Roll dough into thin circles.
o Fry in hot oil until crispy.
o Drain on paper towels and serve.
Patatas Bravas
Ingredients:
o 4 potatoes
o 1/4 cup olive oil

o 1/2 cup tomato sauce
o 1 teaspoon paprika
o 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
o 1/2 teaspoon salt
o 1/4 cup mayonnaise
Instructions:
o Peel and dice potatoes.
o Toss potatoes with olive oil and salt, then roast at 400°F (200°C) until crispy.
o Mix tomato sauce, paprika, and cayenne pepper in a bowl.
o Serve potatoes with tomato sauce and a dollop of mayonnaise.
Pepper Pot
Ingredients:
o 1 pound beef
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 4 cups beef broth
o 1 cup spinach
o 1 cup okra
o 1 teaspoon thyme
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Sauté diced beef, onion, and minced garlic until browned.
o Add beef broth, thyme, salt, and pepper, simmer for 1 hour.
o Stir in spinach and okra, cook until tender.
o Serve warm.
Peri-Peri Chicken
Ingredients:
o 1 pound chicken thighs
o 1/4 cup peri-peri sauce
o 2 tablespoons olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Marinate chicken in peri-peri sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper for at least 1 hour.
o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked
through.
o Serve warm.
Pico de Gallo
Ingredients:

o 4 tomatoes
o 1 small onion
o 1 jalapeño
o 1/4 cup cilantro
o 1 lime
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Dice tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño.
o Chop cilantro.
o Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
o Squeeze lime juice over the mixture and add salt.
o Mix well and serve.
Pimientos de Padrón
Ingredients:
o 1 pound Padrón peppers
o 2 tablespoons olive oil
o 1 teaspoon sea salt
Instructions:
o Heat olive oil in a pan.
o Add Padrón peppers and sauté until blistered and tender.
o Sprinkle with sea salt and serve warm.
Plantain Chips
Ingredients:
o 2 green plantains
o 1 cup vegetable oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Peel and slice plantains thinly.
o Heat oil in a pan and fry plantain slices until crispy.
o Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
o Serve warm.
Polenta
Ingredients:
o 1 cup cornmeal
o 4 cups water
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 2 tablespoons butter
o 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
Instructions:
o Bring water and salt to a boil.
o Gradually whisk in cornmeal.
o Reduce heat and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened (about 30 minutes).

o Stir in butter and Parmesan cheese.
o Serve warm.
Potato Salad
Ingredients:
o 4 potatoes
o 2 eggs
o 1 small onion
o 1/2 cup mayonnaise
o 2 tablespoons mustard
o 1 tablespoon vinegar
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice.
o Hard-boil eggs, then chop.
o Mix potatoes, eggs, diced onion, mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
Pretzels
Ingredients:
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
o 1 teaspoon sugar
o 1 cup warm water
o 3 cups flour
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/4 cup baking soda
o 1 egg
o Coarse salt
Instructions:
o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy.
o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture.
o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled.
o Divide dough into pieces and roll into ropes, then shape into pretzels.
o Boil water with baking soda and dip pretzels in the solution.
o Place on a baking sheet, brush with beaten egg, and sprinkle with coarse salt.
o Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 12-15 minutes until golden.
o Serve warm.
Pulao
Ingredients:
o 1 cup basmati rice
o 2 cups water
o 1 small onion

o 1 carrot
o 1/2 cup peas
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon coriander
o 1 teaspoon turmeric
o 1 teaspoon garam masala
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 2 tablespoons oil
Instructions:
o Rinse rice and soak in water for 30 minutes.
o Heat oil in a pan and sauté diced onion until translucent.
o Add diced carrot, peas, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, cook for 1
minute.
o Drain rice and add to the pan, stir to coat with spices.
o Add water and bring to a boil.
o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water is absorbed.
o Add salt to taste and serve.
Quesadillas
Ingredients:
o 4 flour tortillas
o 2 cups shredded cheese
o 1/2 cup diced cooked chicken (optional)
o 1/4 cup chopped cilantro
o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Instructions:
o Heat oil in a pan.
o Place a tortilla in the pan and sprinkle with cheese, chicken, and cilantro.
o Top with another tortilla.
o Cook until cheese is melted and tortilla is golden, then flip and cook the other
side.
o Cut into wedges and serve.
Quiche Lorraine
Ingredients:
o 1 pie crust
o 6 slices bacon
o 1 small onion
o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese
o 3 eggs
o 1 cup heavy cream
o 1/2 teaspoon salt
o 1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:

o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
o Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble.
o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened.
o Place pie crust in a pie dish and sprinkle with bacon, onion, and cheese.
o Beat eggs with cream, salt, and pepper, then pour over the filling.
o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden.
o Serve warm.
Quindim
Ingredients:
o 2 cups sugar
o 1 cup coconut
o 1/4 cup butter
o 10 egg yolks
o 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions:
o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
o Mix sugar, coconut, melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla extract in a bowl.
o Pour mixture into greased muffin tins.
o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden.
o Let cool before removing from tins.
o Serve chilled.
Raita
Ingredients:
o 1 cup yogurt
o 1/2 cucumber
o 1/4 cup mint
o 1/4 teaspoon cumin
o 1/4 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture.
o Mix yogurt with cucumber, chopped mint, cumin, and salt.
o Serve chilled.
Ratatouille
Ingredients:
o 1 eggplant
o 1 zucchini
o 1 bell pepper
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 4 tomatoes
o 1 teaspoon thyme

o 1 teaspoon rosemary
o 1/4 cup olive oil
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Dice eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, and tomatoes.
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened.
o Add eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, tomatoes, thyme, rosemary, and salt.
o Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
o Serve warm.
Rau Muong Xao Toi (Stir-Fried Morning Glory with Garlic)
Ingredients:
o 1 pound morning glory
o 4 cloves garlic
o 2 tablespoons fish sauce
o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Instructions:
o Sauté minced garlic in vegetable oil until fragrant.
o Add morning glory and stir-fry until tender.
o Add fish sauce and cook for 2 minutes.
o Serve warm.
Refried Beans
Ingredients:
o 2 cups cooked pinto beans
o 1/4 cup lard or vegetable oil
o 1 small onion
o 1 clove garlic
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Heat lard or oil in a pan and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until

o Add beans and mash with a potato masher.
o Cook, stirring frequently, until beans are thickened.
o Add salt to taste and serve.
Rfissa

o 1 pound chicken
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon turmeric
o 1 teaspoon ginger

o 1 teaspoon salt

o 1/4 cup lentils
o 1/4 cup cilantro
o 4 pieces flatbread
Instructions:
o Sauté chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic in olive oil until browned.
o Add cumin, turmeric, ginger, and salt, cook for 1 minute.
o Add chicken broth and lentils, simmer until chicken is cooked and lentils are
tender.
o Stir in chopped cilantro.
o Tear flatbread into pieces and place in a serving dish.
o Pour chicken and sauce over the bread and serve warm.
Rice and Peas
Ingredients:
o 1 cup rice
o 1 cup coconut milk
o 1 cup water
o 1/2 cup kidney beans
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1 teaspoon thyme
o 1 teaspoon salt
Instructions:
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
o Add rice, coconut milk, water, kidney beans, thyme, and salt.
o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender.
o Serve warm.

Ingredients:
o 1 pound pork shoulder
o 1/2 cup duck fat
o 1/4 cup white wine
o 1 teaspoon thyme
o 1 teaspoon salt
o 1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions:
o Cut pork into small pieces.
o Cook pork with duck fat, wine, thyme, salt, and pepper in a pot over low heat
until very tender (about 3 hours).
o Shred pork with a fork and pack into jars.

o Chill until set.
o Serve with bread.

o 1 cup Arborio rice
o 4 cups chicken broth
o 1/2 cup white wine
o 1 small onion
o 2 cloves garlic
o 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
o 2 tablespoons butter
o 1 tablespoon olive oil
Instructions:
o Heat broth in a pot and keep warm.
o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until translucent.
o Add rice and cook until lightly toasted.
o Pour in wine and cook until absorbed.
o Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed.
o Continue until rice is creamy and tender.
o Stir in butter and grated Parmesan cheese.
o Serve immediately.

o 1/2 teaspoon pepper

o Grate potatoes and onion, then squeeze out excess moisture.
o Mix with flour, beaten egg, salt, and pepper.
o Form mixture into patties.
o Fry in hot oil until golden on both sides.
o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

o Serve warm.

o Toss gently and serve.

o Dice onion, grate carrot, and chop apple.
o Mix shredded chicken with onion, carrot, apple, raisins, mayonnaise, chopped

o Serve chilled.

o 1 teaspoon salt

o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

o 1 teaspoon cumin
o 1 teaspoon coriander
